com.ojcoleman.bain.base

Class SynapseCollection<C extends SynapseConfiguration>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.ComponentCollection
        • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
          • com.ojcoleman.bain.base.SynapseCollection<C>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentConfigurationListener, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Clopath2010SynapseCollection, FixedSynapseCollection, Graupner2012SimplifiedSynapseCollection, Graupner2012SynapseCollection, Niv2002SynapseCollection, Pfister2006SynapseCollection

    public abstract class SynapseCollection<C extends SynapseConfiguration>
extends ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>

    Base class for all synapse collections. A SynapseCollection is expected to be used in conjunction with a NeuronCollection; The methods to set and get the pre- and post-synaptic neurons for a synapse reference the index of neurons in the associated NeuronCollection.

    Sub-classes must override the methods run(), ComponentCollection.createCollection(int size) ConfigurableComponentCollection.getConfigSingleton(). Sub-classes will need to override the methods init(),reset() and ensureStateVariablesAreFresh() if they use custom state variables. Sub-classes may wish/need to override the methods: step(), getStateVariableNames() and getStateVariableValues(int).

    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

    • Field Detail

      • efficacy

        public double[] efficacy
        The current efficacy of each synapse.

      • initialEfficacy

        public double[] initialEfficacy
        The initial efficacy of each synapse. The efficacy of each synapse is reset to this when reset() is called. By default the initial efficacy for each synapse is 0, but will be set (along with efficacy) when setEfficacy(int, double) is called.

      • neuronOutputs

        protected double[] neuronOutputs
        The ComponentCollection.outputs from the associated NeuronCollection.

      • neuronSpikings

        protected boolean[] neuronSpikings
        The NeuronCollection.spikings from the associated NeuronCollection.

      • neuronInputs

        protected double[] neuronInputs
        The NeuronCollection.inputs from the associated NeuronCollection.

      • preIndexes

        protected int[] preIndexes
        Indexes of the pre-synaptic neurons for each synapse.

      • postIndexes

        protected int[] postIndexes
        Indexes of the post-synaptic neurons for each synapse.

      • preOrPostIndexesModified

        protected boolean preOrPostIndexesModified
        Flag to indicate if the pre- or post-synaptic connections have changed for any synapse. This is used to determine if we need to put() the preIndexes and postIndexes arrays/buffers when using OpenCL.

      • efficaciesModified

        protected boolean efficaciesModified
        Flag to indicate if the efficacy values have been manually modified since the last simulation step.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to generate pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class ConfigurableComponentCollection<C extends SynapseConfiguration>

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets all synapses to their initial state (see initialEfficacy). Sub-classes should override this method if state variables other than the efficacy and synapseOutputs must be reset, or if they should be set to something other than 0. The overriding method should invoke this super-method (before doing anything else). Arrays/buffers reset here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        reset in class ComponentCollection

      • step

        public void step()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Update the model over one time step. Sub-classes should call this super method. The step() method will invoke the overridden run() method which defines the Aparapi kernel. This method sets ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale and ComponentCollection.outputsStale to true.
        Overrides:
        step in class ComponentCollection

      • run

        public void run()
        Implements the basic infrastructure for processing a synapse by updating the values of ComponentCollection.outputs and neuronInputs. Sub-classes may override this method, and if they modify the efficacy they must call the super-method after modifying it.
        Specified by:
        run in class com.amd.aparapi.Kernel

      • getInput

        public double getInput(int index)
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Returns the input value of the specified component for the next time step.
        Specified by:
        getInput in class ComponentCollection

      • getInputs

        public double[] getInputs()
        Returns the underlying array of input values. This method is provided for efficiency reasons, the values of the array should not be altered directly. The values in the array returned by this method may become stale if the step() method is invoked subsequently; to get fresh values this method should be invoked again (this will return the same array but will also ensure that the values in the array are up to date by invoking ensureInputsAreFresh()). A SynapseCollection uses the outputs of pre-synaptic neurons as inputs, thus it does not provide a reference to an internal array. Instead an array is generated with an element for each synapse, and the relevant output values for each pre-synaptic neuron copied into it. Consider using getInputs(double[]).
        Specified by:
        getInputs in class ComponentCollection

      • getInputs

        public double[] getInputs(double[] inputs)
        Produces the same output as getInputs() but accepts an array to put the data in. If the the given array has length less than ComponentCollection.getSize(), or is null, a new array is created.

      • addInput

        public void addInput(int index,
            double input)
        SynapseCollection implements this as an empty method as it generally does not make sense to add external input to a synapse. The same effect can be achieved by adding to the output value of the pre-synaptic neuron.
        Specified by:
        addInput in class ComponentCollection

      • ensureInputsAreFresh

        public void ensureInputsAreFresh()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Ensures the inputs, as provided by ComponentCollection.getInput(int index) and ComponentCollection.getInputs() have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See ComponentCollection.inputsAreStale().
        Specified by:
        ensureInputsAreFresh in class ComponentCollection

      • getEfficacy

        public double getEfficacy(int synapseIndex)

        Returns:
        the current strength (weight) value.

      • setEfficacy

        public void setEfficacy(int synapseIndex,
               double newEfficacy)
        Set current strength (weight) value. This will also set the corresponding value in initialEfficacy.
        Parameters:
        synapseIndex - The index of the synapse to set the efficacy of.
        newEfficacy - The new efficacy value.

      • getEfficacies

        public double[] getEfficacies()
        Returns a reference to the internal efficacy array, to allow efficient getting and setting of efficacy values. If reading values from the returned array, this method must be called after every call to NeuralNetwork.step() or NeuralNetwork.run(int). This will ensure that the current values are retrieved from the SIMD hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. If setting values in the returned array the method setEfficaciesModified() must be called.. This will ensure that the modified values are pushed to the SIMD hardware if necessary during the next simulation step.

      • setEfficaciesModified

        public void setEfficaciesModified()
        If setting values in the array returned by getEfficacies() this method must be called. This will ensure that the modified values are pushed to the SIMD hardware if necessary during the next simulation step and will update the values in initialEfficacy.

      • getComponentConfiguration

        public SynapseConfiguration getComponentConfiguration(int componentIndex)

        Overrides:

      • ensureStateVariablesAreFresh

        public void ensureStateVariablesAreFresh()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Ensure the state variable values have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale. Implementations of this method should set ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale to false. (If sub-classes override an implementation of this method they should typically call the super method after they have fetched any data from the remote execution hardware as the overridden implementation of this method should set ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale false).
        Specified by:
        ensureStateVariablesAreFresh in class ComponentCollection

      • getStateVariableNames

        public java.lang.String[] getStateVariableNames()
        Get an array containing the names of all the internal state variables. Sub-classes may override this to allow the component to be used for testing or educational purposes. This default implementation returns the efficacy field.
        Overrides:
        getStateVariableNames in class ComponentCollection

      • getStateVariableValues

        public double[] getStateVariableValues(int synapseIndex)
        Get an array containing the values of all the internal state variables, in the same order as that given by getStateVariableNames(). Sub-classes may override this to allow the component to be used for testing or educational purposes. The overriding method should ensure the state variables are up to date by invoking ComponentCollection.ensureStateVariablesAreFresh(). This default implementation returns the efficacy field.
        Overrides:
        getStateVariableValues in class ComponentCollection
